title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Economic complexity modelling pioneered Hidalgo Hausmann (2009) tool measures industrial productive knowledge present region based products exports comparative advantage (Hausmann, Hwang, Rodrik 2007; Hausmann et al. 2014; Hidalgo et al. 2007). Economic complexity calculated using country-product export data, spanning period 1995-2020, 1,200 products (disaggregated 1992 version Harmonised System, called HS0), 200 countries. Economic complexity highly predictive current future economic growth. reveals three key indicators region’s economic development: productive capabilities present region, similarity capabilities required develop new products, benefit region’s complexity development new product. products included economic complexity data can searched . Preliminary analysis regional export data reveals products (\(p\)) exported comparative advantage region (\(c\)). Regional Comparative Advantage (RCA) measured Balassa Index defined share exports product region relative share exports product global trade. \[RCA_{cp} = \frac{X_{cp}}{\sum_{c}X_{cp}}/\frac{\sum_{p}X_{cp}}{\sum_{cp}X_{cp}}\] region said comparative advantage product \(RCA_{cp} >=1\). benefit region’s economic complexity development new product quantified complexity outlook gain (COG). quantifies development new product increases number opportunities future diversification creation new paths existing products complex products.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Australia, smallest geographic region consistent accurate export data measured made available state level. Queensland Government Statistician’s Office provides time series state exports disaggregated 8-digit Australian Harmonised Export Commodity Classification (AHECC). AHECC modified version Harmonised System, designed capture include products specific importance Australian industry. , can readily converted Harmonised System inclusion country-product export data provided Atlas Economic Complexity (2014). 6-digit level (disaggregated level available international trade), AHECC HS identical. year state export data converted 6-digit AHECC 6-digit HS using United Nations Trade Statistics Correspondence Tables (UN Trade Statistics 2022). recent state export data uses combination different versions Harmonised System. conversion algorithm first uses oldest available version Harmonised System (HS0), match 6-digit AHECC. conversion AHECC HS unsuccessful (.e., state export data uses HS code recent correspondence), matches kept, next version correspondence used find matches unsuccessful product codes. repeated AHECC codes matched HS 1992 codes. state level economic complexity data 2011 onwards included package.
code: state_economic_complexity #> # A tibble: 248,496 × 13 #>    location_code     hs_product_code export_value  year diversity ubiquity   mcp #>    <chr>             <chr>                  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Australian Capit… 0101                       0  1996        63       22     0 #>  2 Australian Capit… 0102                       0  1996        63       36     0 #>  3 Australian Capit… 0103                       0  1996        63       11     0 #>  4 Australian Capit… 0104                       0  1996        63       31     0 #>  5 Australian Capit… 0105                       0  1996        63       21     0 #>  6 Australian Capit… 0106                       0  1996        63       70     0 #>  7 Australian Capit… 0201                       0  1996        63       26     0 #>  8 Australian Capit… 0202                       0  1996        63       31     0 #>  9 Australian Capit… 0203                       0  1996        63       14     0 #> 10 Australian Capit… 0204                   27996  1996        63       23     1 #> # … with 248,486 more rows, and 6 more variables: eci <dbl>, pci <dbl>, #> #   density <dbl>, coi <dbl>, cog <dbl>, rca <dbl>

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Employment industry data used determine industrial comparative advantage region, defined Statistical Area Level 2 (SA2). simple measure employment industry inadequate measure industrial strengths able determine one region outperforms another. example, Preschool School Education largest employing industry 25% regions. alleviate , industrial comparative advantage estimated identify industries region employs higher share Australian average. : \[ICA_{ri} = \frac{E_{ri}}{\sum_{r}E_{ri}}/\frac{\sum_{}E_{ri}}{\sum_{ri}E_{ri}}\] \(ICA_{ri}\) industrial comparative advantage region \(r\) industry \(\) \(E_{ri}\) level employment region \(r\) industry \(\). Employment industry data sourced ABS Census TableBuilder, Counting Employed Persons, Place Work (POW) (Australian Bureau Statistics (2016, n.d.). data included aurininnovation package sa2_indp2_2011 sa2_indp2_2016.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Industrial comparative advantage can calculated using built ica() function. function requires dataset least three columns containing following data: variable specifying geographical region investigated. variable specifying industry. variable specifying value employment industry geographical region. included sa2_indp2_2011 sa2_indp2_2016 meet specification. industrial comparative advantage can calculated ica() function. default, ica() calculates industrial comparative advantage years - currently 2011 2016. Individual years can calcualted specifying year. also removes regions total employment less 150, account perturbations applied ABS small cell values TableBuilder. produces dataset provided AURIN. control calculation industrial comparative advantage available. example, calculate industrial comparative advantage using employment industry adjusted remove “defined” industries, specify value variable employment_adj. minimum value region’s total employment can controlled specifying min_value. Additionally, data can filtered based size total industry employment specifying min_value total_var. Industries less 2000 employees can removed follows:
code: #> # A tibble: 240,660 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                           employment  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                                   <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd                      8  2016 #>  2 Braidwood Agriculture                                               217  2016 #>  3 Braidwood Aquaculture                                                 0  2016 #>  4 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                        4  2016 #>  5 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                               0  2016 #>  6 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services         15  2016 #>  7 Braidwood Mining, nfd                                                 0  2016 #>  8 Braidwood Coal Mining                                                 0  2016 #>  9 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                                      0  2016 #> 10 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                            0  2016 #> # what: Reproduction of Industrial Growth Opportunities Dataset
title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: industrial growth opportunities dataset combines regional data industrial strengths, calculated Industrial Comparative Advantage index (SA2 level), product opportunity data state level, calculated state economic complexity model. allows productive capabilities present state level matched industrial capabilities present regional level. Products state_economic_complexity dataset matched industry produces , based ABS International Merchandise Trade Appendix 6.1 AHECC Historical Correspondence (Statistics 2018, n.d.). industry matched industry strengths identified Industrial Comparative Advantage data. Industrial growth opportunities region products meet following criteria: 1. produced industry region industrial comparative advantage. 2. exported State region located revealed comparative advantage. 3. exported capacity State region located. 4. increase economic complexity State region located. full industrial growth opportunities dataset can generated using conditions outlined igo() function. Specific regions products can specified: Similar industrial comparative advantage calculation, default conditions can overridden.
code: igo(year = 2016) #> Joining, by = "sa2_name" #> # A tibble: 317,400 × 11 #>     Year `Statistical Area 2 …` `Statistical A…` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` #>    <dbl> <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>            <chr>          #>  1  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Vegetable saps … 1302           #>  2  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Glycerol         1520           #>  3  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Waters           2201           #>  4  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Waters, flavore… 2202           #>  5  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Spirits < 80% a… 2208           #>  6  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Iodine           2801           #>  7  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Carbon           2803           #>  8  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Silicon & rare … 2804           #>  9  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Rare-earth meta… 2805           #> 10  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Sulfiric acid, … 2807           #> # A tibble: 5 × 11 #>    Year `Statistical Area 2 C…` `Statistical A…` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` #>   <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>            <chr>          #> 1  2016 401011001               Adelaide         Books, brochure… 4901           #> 2  2016 401011001               Adelaide         Newspapers, jou… 4902           #> 3  2016 401011001               Adelaide         Children's books 4903           #> 4  2016 206041122               Melbourne        Newspapers, jou… 4902           #> 5  2016 206041122               Melbourne        Maps             4905           #> # title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Australian Bureau Statistics (2016, 2011). n.d. “Employed Persons Industry (Indp2) Statistical Area 2 (Sa2), Place Work.” Census TableBuilder Pro. Hausmann, R., C. . Hidalgo, S. Bustos, M. Coscia, . Simoes. 2014. Atlas Economic Complexity: Mapping Paths Prosperity. Online Access: OAPEN Open Research Library. MIT Press. https://books.google.com.au/books?id=cp-NAgAAQBAJ. Hausmann, Ricardo, Jason Hwang, Dani Rodrik. 2007. “Export Matters.” Journal Economic Growth 12 (1): 1–25. Hidalgo, César , Ricardo Hausmann. 2009. “Building Blocks Economic Complexity.” Proceedings National Academy Sciences 106 (26): 10570–5. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.0900943106. Hidalgo, César , Bailey Klinger, -L Barabási, Ricardo Hausmann. 2007. “Product Space Conditions Development Nations.” Science 317 (5837): 482–87. Statistics 2018, Australian Bureau . n.d. “International Merchandise Trade, Australia: Concepts, Sources Methods.” https://www.abs.gov.au/AUSSTATS/subscriber.nsf/log?openagent&5489.0_2018.xlsx&5489.0&Data%20Cubes&E6F604B67A13BA6CCA2586640012E3DD&0&2018&30.06.2021&Latest. UN Trade Statistics. 2022. “Correspondence Tables.” https://unstats.un.org/unsd/trade/classifications/correspondence-tables.asp.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hamish Gamble. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gamble H (2022). aurininnovation: Quantifying Regional Innovation. R package version 0.1.0, https://aiti-flinders.github.io/aurin-innovation/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {aurininnovation: Quantifying Regional Innovation},   author = {Hamish Gamble},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://aiti-flinders.github.io/aurin-innovation/}, }

title: Quantifying Regional Innovation
text: package contains data analysis component AURIN High Impact Project “Quantifying Regional Innovation”. Datasets required project include: Industrial comparative advantage SA2 level 2011, 2016, 2021 pending release ABS 2021 census. Industrial growth opportunities SA2 level 2011, 2016, 2021 pending release ABS 2021 census. Knowledge capability SA2 level. Innovation SA2 level.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: create_designs() creates data frame number designs filed geographic given year.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: year numeric. year designs filed. geography string. geographic region interest. Defaults SA2

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: data frame designs geography given year.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: designs applied Australia included. data derived Intellectual Property Government Open Data, includes: IPGOD 301 Designs Summary IPGOD 302 Designs Applicant Information information IPGOD data available IPGOD Data Dictionary.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: Industrial Comparative Advantage

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: years year calculate industrial comparative advantage. default, "", calculate industrial comparative advantage available years. Available years 2011 2016. ... Additional options passed calculation location quotient. See location_quotient information.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: igo() creates data frame industrial growth opportunities across Statistical Area Level 2 regions 2011 2016.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
code: igo(   year,   region = NULL,   product = NULL,   .export_value_limit = 0,   .cog_limit = 0,   .rca_limit = 1,   .ica_limit = 1,   ... )

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: year numeric. year calculate industrial growth opportunities. region character. Show industrial growth opportunities given region. default (NULL) return industrial growth opportunities regions. product character. Show regions opportunity given product. default (NULL) return industrial growth opportunities products .export_value_limit (optional) numeric. minimum state export value product required considered growth opportunity region. default (0) excludes products exported. .cog_limit (optional) numeric. minimum benefit product generate region. default (0) excludes products negative benefits. .rca_limit (optional) numeric. maximum value level revealed comparative advantage production opportunity state. default (1) excludes products already produced comaprative advantage. .ica_limit (optional) numeric. minimum value level industrial comparative advantage. default (1) excludes products made industries region higher proportion employment Australia. ... (optional). Additional arguments passed ica()

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: data frame industrial growth opportunities.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: industrial growth opportunities derived industrial comparative advantage data (see ica()), State based model economic complexity, developed Australian Industrial Transformation Institute Flinders University, collaboration Government South Australia. Industrial growth opportunities capture, product level, industrial development : beneficial region, suitable region based industrial strengths.

Override defaults. # Increasing the export value limit (from 0) focuses the opportunities # on those with a stronger existing industrial base.  # Increasing the COG limit (from 0) focuses the opportunities # on those which would bring a higher benefit to the region.  # Decreasing the RCA limit (from 1) focuses the opportunities # on those which are less developed in the State.  # Increasing the ICA limit (from 1) focuses the opportunities # on industries in which a region has a significant comparative advantage.  igo(2016, .export_value_limit = 1000, .cog_limit = 0.5, .rca_limit = 0.5, .ica_limit = 0.5) #> Joining, by = "sa2_name" #> # A tibble: 317,708 × 11 #>     Year `Statistical Area 2 …` `Statistical A…` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` #>    <dbl> <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>            <chr>          #>  1  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Pig and poultry… 0209           #>  2  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Preserved meat   0210           #>  3  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Wheat gluten     1109           #>  4  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Pig and poultry… 1501           #>  5  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Glycerol         1520           #>  6  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Mushrooms, prep… 2003           #>  7  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Carbon           2803           #>  8  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Silicon & rare … 2804           #>  9  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Rare-earth meta… 2805           #> 10  2016 206071139              Abbotsford       Sulfonitric aci… 2808           #> # title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: Calculate location quotient data contains column specifying geographic variable, second variable industry employment, value. data provided converted matrix dimensions x_var * y_var. variable specified value_var fills matrix. Examples include: Revealed Comparative Advantage country-product-export data. Industrial Comparative Advantage region-industry-employment data.

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
code: location_quotient(   data,   min_value = 0,   total_var = NULL,   x_var = NULL,   y_var = NULL,   value_var = NULL )

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: data dataframe min_value numeric. smallest total value allowable geographic region. total_var character. name variable must greater min_value. variable must present data passed function. x_var character. name variable treated rows. y_var character. name variable treated columns. value_var character. name variable treated value.

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: tibble
